intro: Norantea guianensis var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender norantea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
